lines.content: gigglebytes.GiggleBytes is a interactive, task manager style chatbot that is still under development
Adds a simple task without any date/time attached.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Adds a task that needs to be done before a specific date/time.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 6 tasks in the list.
Adds a task that starts and ends at specific times.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 7 tasks in the list.
**Command:** `Shows all tasks with their completion status.`
**Command:** `mark [number]: Marks the specified task as completed.`
Nice! >.< I've marked this task as done:
**Command:** `unmark [number]: Marks the specified task as not completed.`
OK ;-; , I've marked this task as not done yet:
**Command:** `exits and closes gigglebytes.GiggleBytes, showing a summary of completed tasks.`
Byte you later! Hope to see you again soon!
* The main class for the GiggleBytes task management application.
* GiggleBytes is a personal digital task manager that helps users
* track and complete their tasks. It supports todo tasks, deadlines,
* and events with a command-line interface and GUI.
* Initializes the UI, storage, and loads existing tasks from file.

assert taskList != null : "TaskList should exist when saving";
assert storage != null : "Storage should exist when saving";

* Handles all user interface interactions for the GiggleBytes application.
* This class is responsible for displaying messages to the user,
* reading user input, and managing the command-line interface.
* Constructs a new Ui instance with a Scanner for user input.
* Displays the welcome message and application logo.
* Also shows available commands to help the user get started.

System.out.println("I can help you track and complete your tasks! >.<");

System.out.println("  - Mark task as done: Type 'mark [number]'");

* Represents a command to add a deadline task to the task list.
* Constructs an AddDeadlineCommand with the specified description and due date/time.
* @param description The description of the deadline task
* @param by The due date/time for the deadline
assert description != null : "Description cannot be null";
assert by != null : "By date cannot be null";
* Executes the command by adding a deadline task to the task list.
* @param taskList The TaskList to add the deadline to
* @param ui The Ui to display messages to the user
* @param storage The Storage to save tasks (not used in this command)
* @throws GiggleBytesException If the task list is full and cannot add more tasks
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws GiggleBytesException {
assert taskList != null : "TaskList cannot be null";
assert ui != null : "Ui cannot be null";
throw new GiggleBytesException("Task storage is full! Can't add more tasks. ;-;");
ui.showMessage("Got it. I've added this task:");
ui.showMessage("Now you have " + taskList.getItemCount() + " tasks in the list.");

* Represents an executable command in the GiggleBytes application.
* This is an abstract base class for all command types. Each specific
* command (e.g., AddTodoCommand, DeleteCommand) extends this class
* Executes the command with the given context.
* @param taskList The TaskList containing all tasks
* @param ui The Ui for user interaction
* @param storage The Storage for saving/loading tasks
* @throws GiggleBytesException If an error occurs during command execution
public abstract void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws GiggleBytesException;
* Returns whether this command should cause the application to exit.
* By default, commands don't cause the application to exit.
* Only ExitCommand overrides this to return true.

assert taskList != null : "TaskList cannot be null";
assert ui != null : "Ui cannot be null";
ui.showMessage("Your task list is empty! There's nothing to delete! ;-;");
ui.showMessage("Please choose a number between 1 and " + taskList.getItemCount());
ui.showMessage("Now you have " + taskList.getItemCount() + " tasks in the list.");

public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

* Represents a command to mark or unmark a task as done.

* Executes the command by marking or unmarking the specified task.
* @param taskList The TaskList containing the task to modify
* @param ui The Ui to display messages to the user
* @param storage The Storage (not used in this command)
* @throws GiggleBytesException If an error occurs during execution
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws GiggleBytesException {
assert taskList != null : "TaskList cannot be null";
assert ui != null : "Ui cannot be null";
String actionText = markAsDone ? "mark as done" : "mark as not done";
ui.showMessage("Your task list is empty! There's nothing to " + actionText + "! ;-;");
ui.showMessage("Please choose a number between 1 and " + taskList.getItemCount());
assert task != null : "Task at valid index should not be null";
ui.showMessage("Nice! >.< I've marked this task as done:");
ui.showMessage("This task was already marked as done!  0-0");
ui.showMessage("OK ;-; , I've marked this task as not done yet:");
ui.showMessage("This task was already marked as not done! <.<");

* Represents a task in the GiggleBytes application.
* This is an abstract base class for all task types (Todo, Deadline, Event).
* Each task has a description and a completion status.
public abstract class Task implements Displayable {
* Constructs a new Task with the given description.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description The description of the task
assert description != null : "Task description cannot be null";
* Returns the description of the task.

* Returns whether the task is done.
* @return true if the task is done, false otherwise
assert !isDone : "Task should not be already done when marking as done";
* Marks the task as not done.
assert isDone : "Task should be done when marking as not done";
* Returns the status icon for display purposes.
* [X] for done tasks, [ ] for not done tasks.
* Returns the type icon for this task.
* Returns the display string representation of the task.
* @return The display string for the task
assert getTypeIcon() != null : "Type icon cannot be null";
* Returns the string representation of the task.
* @return The string representation of the task

* Represents an object that can be displayed in the user interface.
* Classes implementing this interface provide a string representation
* suitable for display to the user.
* Returns a string representation of the object suitable for display.
* An abstract base class for collections of Displayable objects.
* Provides basic operations for managing and displaying a collection
* of items that implement the Displayable interface.
* Constructs a new DisplayableCollection with the specified maximum capacity.
* @param maxCapacity The maximum number of items the collection can hold
assert maxCapacity > 0 : "Max capacity must be positive";
assert items != null : "Items list should be initialized";
assert itemCount == 0 : "Item count should start at 0";
* Returns the number of items in the collection.
assert itemCount >= 0 : "Item count cannot be negative";
assert itemCount <= items.size() : "Item count cannot exceed list size";
* Returns the item at the specified position in the collection.
* Positions are 1-indexed (first item is at position 1).
* @param index The 1-based index of the item to retrieve
* @return The item at the specified index, or null if the index is invalid
assert items.get(index - 1) != null : "Items at valid indices should not be null";
* Prints all items in the collection to standard output.
* If the collection is empty, displays an appropriate message.
* Otherwise, displays each item with its position number.
System.out.println("Your list is empty! Add something first!");
assert itemCount > 0 : "Item count should be positive when printing non-empty list";
assert items.get(i) != null : "All items in collection should be non-null";
* Removes and returns the item at the specified position in the collection.
* Positions are 1-indexed (first item is at position 1).
* @param index The 1-based index of the item to remove
* @return The removed item, or null if the index is invalid
assert items.get(index - 1) != null : "Item to remove should not be null";
assert itemCount == oldCount - 1 : "Item count should decrease by 1 after removal";
* Manages a collection of tasks in the GiggleBytes application.
* This class extends DisplayableCollection and provides specific
* methods for adding, retrieving, and deleting tasks.
* Constructs a new empty TaskList with the specified maximum capacity.
* @param maxCapacity The maximum number of tasks the list can hold
assert maxCapacity > 0 : "Max capacity must be positive";
* Constructs a new TaskList with pre-loaded tasks.
* @param maxCapacity The maximum number of tasks the list can hold
* @param loadedTasks A list of tasks to initialize the TaskList with
assert maxCapacity > 0 : "Max capacity must be positive";
assert loadedTasks != null : "Loaded tasks list cannot be null";
assert itemCount == loadedTasks.size() : "Item count should match loaded tasks size";
* Adds a new todo task to the list.
* @param description The description of the todo
* @return true if the todo was added successfully
assert description != null : "Todo description cannot be null";
assert getTask(itemCount) != null : "Task should be added successfully";
* Adds a new deadline task to the list.
* @param description The description of the deadline
* @param by The due date/time of the deadline
* @return true if the deadline was added successfully
public boolean addDeadline(String description, String by) {
assert description != null : "Deadline description cannot be null";
assert by != null : "Deadline by date cannot be null";
assert !by.trim().isEmpty() : "Deadline by date cannot be empty";
assert added instanceof Deadline : "Added task should be a Deadline";
assert ((Deadline) added).getBy().equals(by) : "Deadline by date should match";
* Adds a new event task to the list.
* @param description The description of the event
* @param from The start date/time of the event
* @param to The end date/time of the event
* @return true if the event was added successfully
public boolean addEvent(String description, String from, String to) {
assert description != null : "Event description cannot be null";
assert from != null : "Event from date cannot be null";
assert to != null : "Event to date cannot be null";
assert !from.trim().isEmpty() : "Event from date cannot be empty";
assert !to.trim().isEmpty() : "Event to date cannot be empty";
assert added instanceof Event : "Added task should be an Event";
* Returns the task at the specified position in the list.
* Positions are 1-indexed (first task is at position 1).
* @param index The 1-based index of the task to retrieve
* @return The task at the specified index, or null if the index is invalid
assert items.get(index - 1) instanceof Task : "Item at valid index should be a Task";
* Removes and returns the task at the specified position in the list.
* Positions are 1-indexed (first task is at position 1).
* @param index The 1-based index of the task to delete
* @return The deleted task, or null if the index is invalid
assert items.get(index - 1) instanceof Task : "Item to delete should be a Task";
assert itemCount == oldCount - 1 : "Item count should decrease by 1 after deletion";
